name: subtype
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a type that forms part of a more general type: More than 60 subtypes of the virus have been identified. Products are listed by manufacturer and then by sub-type. Synonym
subvariety
More examplesFewer examplesThis study identified five types of fibre and numerous subtypes.Some symptoms may not be present in these tumour subtypes, and this can lead to a delay in diagnosis.Doctors now recognize several possible subtypes of this disorder.There are various subtypes of the condition with differing symptoms.
